alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 10:07PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. .The combination of snow melt runoff and forecast rainfall will continue to increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk. * WHEN...From Saturday morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Friday, the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to a crest of 16.5 feet Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.4 feet on 04/09/1997. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
